definition: an act, process, or instance of changing place : movement
an active or functioning state or condition
examples: set the divorce proceedings in motion

definition: an impulse or inclination of the mind or will
examples: the fundamental motions of humanity to good or evil

definition: a proposal for action, a formal proposal made in a deliberative assembly
examples: made a motion that the meeting be adjourned

definition: an application made to a court or judge to obtain an order, ruling, or direction
examples: His motion for a new trial was denied.

definition: an act or instance of moving the body or its parts : gesture
examples: signaled with a motion of his arm
taking advantage of the night to conceal his motions

definition: running parallel to the line of scrimmage before the snap
to signal by a movement or gesture
examples: the pitcher motioned to the catcher

definition: Sir Andrew 1952–     British poet; poet laureate (1999–2009)
